item.title: College debt is making it harder for people to get married
item.description: It is pretty well known that the outstanding college debt burden is surging and having spill over effects on individual’s choices. Per a Federal Reserve Report, 36 percent of individuals aged 24-32 owned homes in 2014, down from the reported 45 percent in 2004. I read this article discussing the effects of co-signing for a partner’s college debt. As the burden of debt increases in both size and the number of effected individuals, the decision for one to marry into one’s debt burden might increasingly be a sticking point for young couples.
